gameDetails.matchup: San Antonio Spurs vs Golden State Warriors
gameDetails.venue: Frost Bank Center, San Antonio, TX

keyFactors.title: Season Average Above Line
keyFactors.description: Wembanyama averaging 26.2 PPG this season, just below but close to 26.5 line. Recent form (28.4 PPG last 5) trended significantly higher.

keyFactors.title: Warriors' Undersized Frontcourt
keyFactors.description: Golden State lacks true rim protector. Draymond Green (6'6") and rotation bigs unable to match Wembanyama's 7'5" length. Major size mismatch.

keyFactors.title: Home Court Dominance
keyFactors.description: Wembanyama averaging 29.1 PPG at home vs 23.8 PPG on road. Frost Bank Center environment brings out elite scoring.

keyFactors.title: High-Pace Warriors Game
keyFactors.description: Warriors play at 4th-fastest pace in NBA. More possessions = more scoring opportunities for Wembanyama in transition and halfcourt.

keyFactors.title: Warriors Poor Interior Defense
keyFactors.description: Golden State allowing 54.2 points in the paint per game (28th in NBA). Wembanyama feasts on weak interior defense.

riskFactors: Warriors could double-team aggressively, forcing Wembanyama to facilitate
Blowout game script could limit Wembanyama's minutes
Foul trouble could reduce playing time
Spurs spreading ball around with Castle's playmaking

quarterBreakdown.description: Aggressive early, Wembanyama dominated Warriors' small frontcourt with 10 points. Set tone immediately with size advantage.
Added 7 points as Spurs built lead. Facilitated more with Castle, but still scoring efficiently. 17 points at half.
Hit 8 points but Warriors' Curry explosion (22 pts Q3) overshadowed. Cleared OVER 26.5 early in Q4 with 25+ through 3 quarters.
Added 6 points to finish with 31. Completed historic triple-double (31-15-10), easily clearing OVER ✓.

gameResults.whenCleared: Early Q4 at approximately 10:30 remaining (27th point), finished with 31
gameResults.gamePace: Fast-paced, high-scoring game (245 combined points). Warriors' tempo created extra possessions, benefiting Wembanyama's scoring opportunities.
gameResults.teamOffense: Wembanyama led Spurs with 31 points on efficient 11-21 shooting. Warriors' lack of rim protection exactly as predicted—he scored at will inside.

whatWentRight.title: Perfect Matchup Exploitation
whatWentRight.description: Warriors' undersized frontcourt had zero answer for Wembanyama's 7'5" frame. He scored 31 on 52.4% shooting, dominating inside exactly as projected.

whatWentRight.title: Home Court Scoring Boost
whatWentRight.description: Wembanyama's home scoring average (29.1 PPG) proved predictive. Frost Bank Center environment brought out elite offensive performance.

whatWentRight.title: High-Pace Game Script
whatWentRight.description: Warriors' fast pace (245 combined points) created extra possessions. More opportunities = more points for Wembanyama.

whatWentRight.title: Cleared Early, No Sweat
whatWentRight.description: Hit 27th point early Q4, cleared OVER with 10+ minutes left. No garbage-time stress, dominant throughout all 36 minutes.

whatWentRight.title: Historic Triple-Double Performance
whatWentRight.description: 31 points, 15 rebounds, 10 assists—4th career triple-double. First Spurs teammates (with Castle) to ever record triple-doubles in same game. Elite all-around game.

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This was expected outcome based on matchup. Warriors' undersized frontcourt (Draymond 6'6") vs Wembanyama's 7'5" length = textbook size mismatch. Home court (29.1 PPG avg) + high pace (245 points) + weak interior D (54.2 paint PPG allowed) = perfect storm for OVER. Model correctly identified edge.

closingLineValue.verdict: Good CLV (+9 cents implied). Line moved toward OVER as sharp money recognized matchup advantage. Early bet captured market inefficiency before adjustment.

keyTakeaways: Matchup-based edges are highly profitable: Size mismatch (7'5" vs 6'6") created undeniable advantage that played out perfectly
Home/road splits matter for young stars: Wembanyama's 29.1 home PPG vs 23.8 road PPG was critical context for projection
Pace creates opportunity: Warriors' fast tempo (4th in NBA) generated extra possessions, boosting Wembanyama's scoring chances
Early clearing reduces stress: Hit OVER early Q4, allowing us to relax final 10+ minutes without sweating garbage time
Triple-double shows all-around dominance: 31-15-10 line showed complete game, not just empty scoring. Elite two-way performance
This is textbook process: Identified matchup edge, got good price, variance worked in our favor. Perfect execution
verdict: Excellent win. Perfect matchup exploitation—Warriors had no defensive answer for Wembanyama's size. Home court (29.1 PPG), high pace, and weak interior defense all aligned. Hit 31 points with historic triple-double. Process and results both elite. Grade: A
